Result.Abstract:
1. We argue that the constancy of c implies a realistic now at a distance in all inertial systems, which in turn leads to determinism.
 
 
 2. We elaborate that denying this violates physical consistency, that requires the concept “velocity”.
 
 
 3. Physics implies models making the world observationally and logically coherent, also as to the experiences of different
 observers. Velocity and
Result.Title: Four-dimensional Reality and Determinism; an Answer to Stein
